intro: Trichilia petenensis, commonly known as the Petén tallowtree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release flat, winged seeds.
